alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Forsyth; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 12:27AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherokee, western Forsyth and northeastern Fulton Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1226 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Roswell, or near Mountain Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cumming, Mountain Park, Roswell, Alpharetta, Milton, Free Home, Drew, Holbrook, Lathemtown, Ducktown, Brookwood and Birmingham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
